How to Install libalt-base-perl on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libalt-base-perl

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libalt-base-perl on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libalt-base-perl on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libalt-base-perl in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libalt-base-perl, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libalt-base-perl Using apt

To install libalt-base-perl in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libalt-base-perl using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libalt-base-perl

The installation of libalt-base-perl might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libalt-base-perl Using apt-get

To install libalt-base-perl using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libalt-base-perl.

sudo apt-get -y install libalt-base-perl

Install libalt-base-perl Using Synaptic

To install libalt-base-perl using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libalt-base-perl on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libalt-base-perl. This will display the libalt-base-perl package in the package window, now to install libalt-base-perl, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libalt-base-perl package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libalt-base-perl.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libalt-base-perl Using aptitude

To install libalt-base-perl on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libalt-base-perl.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libalt-base-perl using the command aptitude install libalt-base-perl.

sudo aptitude -y install libalt-base-perl

How to Upgrade libalt-base-perl on debian

If you want to upgrade the libalt-base-perl package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libalt-base-perl using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libalt-base-perl to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libalt-base-perl.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libalt-base-perl sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libalt-base-perl

Upgrade libalt-base-perl using Aptitude

To upgrade libalt-base-perl using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libalt-base-perl.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libalt-base-perl

Upgrade libalt-base-perl using Synaptic

To upgrade libalt-base-perl using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libalt-base-perl, now right-click libalt-base-perl, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libalt-base-perl just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libalt-base-perl on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libalt-base-perl from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libalt-base-perl, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libalt-base-perl

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libalt-base-perl

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libalt-base-perl you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libalt-base-perl

Remove libalt-base-perl using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libalt-base-perl using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libalt-base-perl, right-click the libalt-base-perl package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libalt-base-perl click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libalt-base-perl on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libalt-base-perl using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libalt-base-perl then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
